page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: {LOCAL HISTORY.Coggeshall}was recorded in the Domesday book and existed in Roman times.It is situated on the Roman road,Stane Street.{HOUSING. There are many Medieval lathe and plaster buildings.Paycockes House is owned by the National Trust.{THE RIVER {BLACKWATER}runs through Coggeshall.By the side of it there is a willow plant ation.The wood is still used to make cricket bats.The Watermill is on the Blackwater.On {ABBEY LANE }there is St Nicholas's Chapel.{SHOPPING}People come from a wide area to see the antique shops.In{MARKET SQUARE}is a Clock Tower,rebuilt in 1887.The weekly market dates from a 1256 Royal Charter {SEED INDUSTRY.}King Seeds send seeds all over the country and to the Queen.Coggeshall is a{MEDIEVAL WOOL {TOWN}as is shown in some pub names. { }
